alert.note: Alert for Benton (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 12:01PM PST until January 04 at 5:23PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oregon... Marys River near Philomath affecting Benton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marys River near Philomath. * WHEN...From this afternoon through late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 21.0 feet, expect major and widespread flooding along the Marys River from Philomath to Corvallis, with numerous homes and farms affected. Several roads will likely be flooded, including Grange Hall Road, 13th Street / Fern Road, Chapel Drive, and Bellfountain Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PST Monday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at 21.1 feet late this afternoon and hold steady through this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM PST.
